sentences.english: More than 10 back words every day, and write.
sentences.chinese: 每天背单词10个以上，并且默写。

sentences.english: She had no time to write down the content from memory tonight.
sentences.chinese: 今天晚上，她没有时间再进行默写了。

sentences.english: Sir, must we write the diction every other line?
sentences.chinese: 老师，默写必须每隔一行写吗？

sentences.english: Then she wrote down the content from memory.
sentences.chinese: 接着，她把内容默写了一遍。

sentences.english: The tutor question his pupils to learn the poem by Listent.
sentences.chinese: 老师要求他的学生要默写这首诗。

sentences.english: The teacher gave us two French dictations today.
sentences.chinese: 老师今天给我们做了两次法文默写测验。

sentences.english: Everybody please take out a piece of paper and write the periodic table from memory.
sentences.chinese: 请大家拿出一张纸，默写化学元素周期表。

sentences.english: After the exit to read 3000 words dictation.
sentences.chinese: 出关后要能读说默写出3000个单词。

sentences.english: He has an excellent memory, and can write the text from memory.
sentences.chinese: 记忆力真是太好了，默写的内容与原文毫分不差。

sentences.english: You will be asked to write down the periodic table.
English teacher told our writing from memory.
Write the Bible passages, from memory if possible.
sentences.chinese: 如可能，请默写圣经章节。

definition: (of a pupil) to write down (in a dictation exercise)/dictation/(music) to transcribe by ear
new character (in textbook)/character that is unfamiliar or not yet studied
to learn by rote/to mechanically memorize
to transcribe/to make a fair copy
variant of 復習|复习[fu4 xi2]
